link.synopsis: Disheartened when his godson moves away, gay artist Paul (Peter Paige) visits the local playground hoping to develop a substitute friendship with the neighborhood children -- until a paranoid mom makes him the town target in this hysterical comedy of errors. Threatened by the presence of this lurking man without a child, Maggie Butler (Kathy Najimy) leads a flock of frenzied parents in a revolt against poor, harmless Paul.
link.title: synopsis

link.synopsis: To the dismay of his mother, Nancy (Wendie Malick), whiz kid Hal Nestor (Justin Long) locks himself in the bathroom to complete math equations and secretly ogle his cheerleader neighbor, Lacy (Danica McKellar), in this black comedy from co-directors Linda Voorhees and Bess Wiley. A battle of wills ensues with Nancy determined to lure her son out for a valedictory speech and Hal equally determined to stay in the can.

Man with a Camera: Complete Collection
Vince Vaughn's Wild West Comedy Show

link.synopsis: A notorious Casanova, Zidane happily leads a life unlike that of his friends Omer and Uri, who endure the agony of commitment. But a beautiful Colombian woman from Zidane's past pulls him into the romantic fray in this lighthearted Israeli comedy.
link.title: synopsis
Turn Left at the End of the World
If You Are the One: Love and Marriage

link.synopsis: In this wacky Bollywood sex comedy, a man (Govinda) finds himself "sandwiched" between two wives -- one (Raveena Tandon) in the city of Mumbai and one (Mahima Chaudhary) in the village of his family. To further complicate matters, the man's double arrives on the scene claiming to be him in this high-spirited farce from director Anees Bazmee.
link.title: synopsis

link.synopsis: A luggage mix-up leads to trouble -- and hilarity -- in this madcap urban comedy starring Laura Hayes, Duffy Hudson and Joeryl Jackson. When young Dino is dispatched to the bus station to pick up his visiting aunt, he inadvertently grabs the wrong suitcase -- one full of greenbacks belonging to the Mafia. Overjoyed by their good fortune, Dino and his family waste no time spending the money ... until the mob comes to collect their loot.
link.title: synopsis
My Big Phat Hip Hop Family
A Film with Me in It

link.synopsis: Well-meaning Madhu (Madhu Balaji) wants to help those in need, but he goes a little too far when he tries to set up his best friend, Cheenu, with a hearing-impaired girl in this family-style Tamil comedy. Madhu's heart is in the right place, but his matchmaking scheme turns into a confusing mess, and there's no telling what will happen once the dust settles. Well-known comedian and playwright Crazy Mohan scripted this rib-tickling production.
link.title: synopsis

link.synopsis: Six seductive businesswomen penetrate the professional world by constructing their own corporation dedicated to very personal customer service in this zany, erotic comedy from Sweden. Once the mayor's wife discovers the disguised debauchery, she leads a full-time campaign to exterminate the carnal enterprise, until her own desires and fantasies are awakened from within the walls of the business brothel. Brigitte Lahaie and Nadine Pascal star.

link.synopsis: In this Mexican comedy, Mr. Lazaro's fashion house is on the brink of bankruptcy and in desperate need of a new model to replace his current business partner's wife, whose appearance is driving customers away. Lazaro's son, Raul, realizes what a diffucult dilemma his father faces and sets out to restore the integrity of the family-owned business by teaming up with his lovely fiancée to put on a fashion show. Domingo Soler and Sara Montiel star.

After an accident befalls Claudia when she arrives in Mexico City, Felipe, the man responsible for the accident, offers to make amends by hiring her as the family maid. But his father mistakenly confuses Claudia for his son's fiancée, and things get even stickier when Felipe's true fiancée, Teresa, arrives. Alma Rosa Aguirre, Ruben Rojo and Domingo Soler star.

link.synopsis: A father stoops to new lows to pay off his debts in this off-kilter comedy from writer-director Kelly Monteith. Running away from his life as a toilet designer for NASA, Ted Beckerwith (Monteith) agrees to assume a false identity and help a "Suderian" princess (Bahar Soomekh) get her green card by marrying her in exchange for $10,000. But keeping his dueling lives separate is more challenging than he ever imagined.

link.synopsis: When six reclusive tenants of a rundown apartment building called Jupiter Landing receive a 30-day eviction notice, they're forced to buck their antisocial ways and band together. Nicki (Naomi West), the reluctant leader, struggles to organize and motivate her slacker neighbors into taking a stand. Joel Riet, Bryce Wagoner, Connie Young, Monique Lanier and Tod Huntington fill out the cast of this independent dark comedy.

When Taylor (Wingo) finally lands that big role he's been waiting for, he quits his job as a waiter -- only to find himself back slinging hash again at the same fashionable restaurant when things don't pan out as he expected.

link.synopsis: Silicon Valley-based director Shawn Flanagan stars in this comedy about a San Jose, Calif., filmmaker's hapless attempts to make a mob movie amid escalating chaos. With no money to speak of and the most famous cast member (Richard Lynch, playing himself) holding the rest of the crew hostage, director Vance Gordon (Flanagan) is determined to make his movie -- even if that means putting the craft services guy in the leading role.

link.synopsis: Raju (Akshay Kumar), Shyam (Sunil Shetty) and Baburao (Paresh Rawal) have everything they want after rising from rags to riches in this sequel to the Indian comedy Hera Pheri. But when Raju gets a chance to double his wealth, he persuades his friends to go in with him on the scheme and borrows money from an investor. He soon realizes they've been duped by a con artist, and now, Raju needs to pay off the investor -- a dangerous gangster -- fast!
link.title: synopsis
Rocket Singh: Salesman of the Year

link.synopsis: Fred Willard stars as a bishop intent on pulling together a winning team for his soon-to-disappear church basketball league in this comedy that  boasts a very unusual cast. Included among the players on the ragtag squad are an Uzbek immigrant, an overweight baker and (most odd of all) the diminutive Gary Coleman, who serves as the center for the team. Mormon filmmaker Kurt Hale directs.

link.synopsis: This independent romantic comedy follows New York filmmaker Michael Connor (played by Michael Leydon Campbell) as he embarks on creating a picture he hopes will reunite him with his ex-girlfriend, Grace (Nadia Dajani). To reenact some of the painful moments he shared with his former love, Michael casts a comely actress (also played by Dajani), who quickly unnerves him by pointing out all of his shortcomings.
link.title: synopsis

link.synopsis: Happy-go-lucky college student Aarya (Allu Arjun) falls in love with Geeta (Anuradha Mehta) at first sight -- never mind that she has a boyfriend (Siva). In fact, the smitten Aarya proposes to his ladylove right in front of him! Uninterested, Geeta turns Aarya down, but her eternally optimistic suitor won't be deterred in this song- and dance-filled romantic comedy from director Sukumar.
link.title: synopsis

link.synopsis: Head of the family Armando (Fernando Allende) moves his brood into a fancy new house after getting a promotion, but more money means more family fights in this sequel to the hilarious 2004 Puerto Rican comedy. Amidst the normal family insanity, Armando helps his neighbors with their wedding plans and deals with his daughter's pregnancy, while jealous wife Lully obsesses over her husband's sexy secretary. Evangelina Elizondo co-stars.

When the bigwig exec moves in for the kill, she tries to enlist Del's help with the takeover. Now, the hapless writer must decide whether to jump over to the dark side, or stand by his long-time colleagues. Brian Vander Ark co-stars.

Director Andrew Bujalski's (Funny Ha Ha) insightful comedy chronicles the uncomfortable courtships and candid conversations among twentysomething Brooklynites stumbling their way through life and love in the urban jungle.

link.synopsis: An underachieving tennis squad must get in shape for a big Las Vegas tournament in this raucous teen comedy. Coach Chip Williams (Richard Roundtree) has the unenviable task of trying to turn the slackers into winning athletes, but with top player The Kid (Scott Strader) leading his teammates on a wild romp through the city, Williams has his hands full just trying to keep them all out of trouble. link.synopsis: A man sells tickets to his own suicide in this absurdist black comedy. Dissatisfied with a likely future following in his penniless baker father's footsteps, Kaz Malek (Pablo Schreiber) steals money from a mobster to fund a new start. But when he's caught, the gangster threatens to kill Kaz's father if he doesn't come up with $10,000. To raise the cash, Kaz charges admission to his own hanging -- but will he give the audience what they came for?

link.synopsis: This Indian comedy features four small-time crooks testing their hand at abducting a millionaire's daughter for quick cash, only to have their plan turned comically chaotic. The bungling kidnappers try to keep their scheme under wraps as they wait for the hostage's father to return from abroad, as well as deal with an onslaught of visiting friends and relatives. The film is lighter fare than usual from famed Bollywood producer Ram Gopal Varma.

link.synopsis: Written from a man's point of view, this unapologetic look at romantic angst stars Joseph Lyle Taylor as Jim Verdi, a guy who can't stay in a relationship with a woman longer than six months. Jim's soulful struggle to overcome what he calls Romantic Attention Deficit Disorder (RADD) offers a fresh, decidedly male take on the typical romantic comedy. Directed by Vincent Rubino, this indie hit was a film festival favorite.
link.title: synopsis
Kama Sutra: A Tale of Love
Great Artists Two with Tim Marlow
Mating Habits of the Earthbound Human
Luke and Brie Are on a First Date

link.synopsis: Fearing that her career will go from pop diva to porn star, a spoiled singer must do everything she can to retrieve the homemade sex tape she accidentally returned to a local video store. But standing between her and the scandalous videotape is a stubborn store clerk who refuses to hand it over and takes perverse delight in making her squirm. David Cormican and Rachel Sehl star in this fresh, independent comedy from Anesty and Spiros Carasoulos.
link.title: synopsis
Scout's Honor: Badge to the Bone
A Love Song for Bobby Long

link.synopsis: Down on their luck, buddies Jamal (William L. Johnson) and Kenny (Benjamin Stephens) decide that the only way they can pluck themselves out of poverty during the summer is to sell oranges from a local kiosk. The new venture seems to be the perfect solution to their financial woes except for one tiny problem: It's hard to keep your mind on business when you're surrounded by beautiful babes. Trey Haley directs this fresh, freewheeling comedy.
link.title: synopsis
Black Woman's Guide to Finding a Good Man

link.synopsis: This very dark comedy follows the path of two unfortunate transients and a hideously noxious adult beverage known as Viper. The homeless gents soon find that the libation, sold to them for a buck by the owner of a local liquor store, actually melts the body of those who drink the toxic brew. If they want to avoid certain death, homeless brothers Fred (Mike Lackey) and Kevin (Marc Sferrazza) will have to resist the temptation to imbibe.
link.title: synopsis
Don't Be a Menace to South Central While Drinking Your Juice in the Hood

link.synopsis: The life of Ajay Sharma (Amol Palekar) becomes complicated when his brother-in-law (Deven Verma) tries to add some spice to Ajay's marriage because his wife (Parveen Babi) thinks he's no longer attracted to her. Instead, the well-intentioned meddling leads Ajay into an affair with his secretary, Anita (Deepti Naval), and causes Ajay's spouse to have a fling with Anita's beau (Farooq Shaikh) in this effervescent comedy.
link.title: synopsis
Love Ke Liye Kuch Bhi Karega

link.synopsis: When Leonid suspects that his wife has had an affair, he fakes a heart attack just to get her to confess. When she admits to a tryst some 30 years ago, Leonid sets off for Russia to hunt down his wife's seducer. What commences is a comedic romp through a modern-day Russia vastly different than the one he remembers. Leonid Kanevsky and Levana Finkelstein star in this Israeli comedy written and directed by Aleksandr Shabatayev.

link.synopsis: Hoping to break into showbiz, aspiring actors Holly and Calvin move from Iowa to New York. When Holly's aunt dies unexpectedly, the two scheme to keep her rent-controlled apartment -- without the landlord wising up. Starring Melissa Joan Hart ("Sabrina, the Teenage Witch"), Ryan Browning and Carmen Electra, this lighthearted comedy follows the high jinks of the young couple as they struggle to find their way in the Big Apple.

After suspecting that his attractive new roommate (Q) is trying to scam him out of his security deposit, Shito (Yin) launches a full-fledged attack for revenge. But when his trickery proves too terrorizing for her, he must nurse her back to health.

Although reporter Charlie Mason (Grant) loves his girlfriend, Monica (Bennett), his new post as the newspaper's city editor drives a wedge between them. When his obsession with his job drives Monica into the arms of another man (Conrad Nagel), only one question remains: What kind of wedding present should Charlie buy for the happy couple?

link.synopsis: Octogenarian grandmother Emilia (Graciana Chironi) squeezes her extended family into a dilapidated motor home for a cross-country road trip teeming with domestic discord in this episodic Argentinian comedy. As they travel toward the Brazilian border to attend a wedding, relationships blossom and fall apart, old feuds reignite, and other thorny issues crop up in the camper's stifling close quarters. Liliana Capurro and Federico Esquerro also star.

link.synopsis: Filmed in 2006 at the Teatro Carlo Felice in Genoa, Italy, this production of Gaetano Donizetti's operatic comedy follows the lovely Marie (Patrizia Ciofi), a young woman bound to the Napoleonic army since birth. Smitten by the beautiful Marie, Swiss lad Tonio (Juan Diego Florez) enlists in order to preserve their love affair -- but she's beckoned by the marquis as an heir and must abandon Tonio and the regiment. Riccardo Frizza conducts.

link.synopsis: Shreeman Funtoosh is having a bad week, to say the least. First, a run-in with a scientist's invention turns him into an iron man. Then, as the scientist tries to cure him, a mishap turns him into a shrinking man. All this, and the only thing Shreeman wants to do is get back to normal so that he can be with his beloved Meena. Kishore Kumar, Kumkum, Anoop Kumar, Jeevankala and S.K. Shyam co-star in this entertaining blend of sci-fi and comedy.

Created by Mauricio Kleiff, the writer of "El Show de los Polivoces," and starring Leonorilda Ochoa, Amparo Arozamena and Sergio "El Comanche" Ramos, "Los Beverly de Peralvillo" was a perennial fan favorite during the late 1960s and early '70s.

Los Angeles hip-hop artist Maxx accepts an invitation to perform at a music festival in Tehran -- and he receives an extremely warm welcome upon his arrival. But what he doesn't know is that everyone thinks he's a prominent symphony conductor with a similar name. When authorities discover they've invited a rapper to their event, riotous chaos ensues.

Worse yet, Jessie (Olga Schoberova) soon comes crashing into their lives for real -- throwing them into a cartoon world of good guys and bad guys.

Marriage, Sid believes, is for other people. So how does he end up proposing? A few tears, it turns out, are all it takes to get Sid down on his knees and set the whole nightmare engagement process in motion in this romantic comedy from director Saket Chaudhary.

link.synopsis: Misunderstandings abound in this romantic comedy from popular Bollywood director K. Ravi Shankar. Handsome DJ Raj -- a compulsive liar -- thinks there's nothing wrong with telling a fib to help a friend. Soon, however, he finds himself caught in his own twisted web when he pretends to be married so that his best friend might have a chance with the boss's daughter, and then pretends to be a government agent when he has to come up with a wife.

Soon, a host of unsavory characters are leading the lieutenant and his cohorts on a wild, monthlong chase through the underbelly of sun-drenched Sydney in a series of interconnected over-the-top crimes. Eloisa, on the other hand, can think of nothing worse than an arranged marriage with a hick like Chencho and flees to the United States, where a job awaits. The work, however, turns out to be at a strip joint, and Chencho may find himself more to Eloisa's liking when he catches up with her.

Director Danny Sapir (played by Jaglom) invites friends and acquaintances who would otherwise be alone to a Valentine's Day party. Circulating among his guests, he asks them for their opinions on relationships, success and loneliness. Sally Kellerman, Andrea Marcovicci, Michael Emil and Orson Welles (in his last film appearance) co-star.

But the pair faces the challenge of their lives when they're kidnapped for real. To rescue their son, Scooter's parents must drop their selfish, philandering ways and discover what success really means. Directed by Jim Sotos, this zany comedy also features Martin Sheen.

Risking careers and husbands, the ladies throw caution to the wind and enter the amorous waters.

Not the smartest move, but who can blame her? Subplots abound as urban eccentrics collide in this wickedly funny melodrama co-starring Benedikte Lindbeck, Fares Fares, Kjersti Holmen and Denis Storhoi.

link.synopsis: After losing their bearings, a group of Chilean soldiers learns some lessons about their enemy's humanity in this dark comedy set during the 1970s war between Chile and Argentina. Digging in where they are, the troop soon discovers a nearby Argentinean platoon. Unsure how to handle the situation, the two groups start passing notes via a stray dog, and eventually achieve a wary camaraderie. Nicolas Saavedra, Erto Pantoja and Victor Montero co-star.

link.synopsis: Two men suffering over the dissolution of their relationships make an unusual pact in this comedy from Argentina. Musician Enrique (Alberto San Juan) will seduce jeweler Javier's (Pere Ponce) ex-wife in order to retrieve some diamonds she still possesses. Meanwhile, Javier will put the moves on Enrique's ex-fiancée to seek revenge for her abandonment. But things don't go as planned, and the mixed-up relationships undergo some unexpected twists.

link.synopsis: Trouble rears its ugly head at the video arcade in this racy teen comedy about a group of kids who battle businessman and concerned parent Joseph Rutter (Joe Don Baker), who believes that video games will destroy the youngsters' minds. When he tries to close down the popular hangout, it's up to King Vidiot (Jon Gries), nerdy Eugene Groebe (Leif Green) and the rest of the gang to defend their right to play Pac-Man.

link.synopsis: Things heat up for a bride-to-be when she wakes up after her wild Las Vegas bachelorette party and discovers that she's already gone to the chapel and married someone else in this romantic comedy. Determined to correct her mistake, the hung-over bride travels to Cancun, Mexico, with her new man to annul the marriage, but doing the right thing won't be as easy as she thinks. Renee Chatman, "D" Ellis, Troy Degar and Tameka Rodriquez star.

link.synopsis: The wildly seductive Pola Negri plays the leader of a band of mountain bandits who falls in love with a lugubrious Bavarian officer in this early slapstick comedy from legendary German director Ernst Lubitsch. Visually stunning and filled with oddball compositions and photographic tricks, the film (shot in Bavaria, where the director liked to winter) is a blunt satire of militarism -- a rarity in post-World War I Germany.

link.synopsis: Set in the bathhouse where the alien princess Valkyrie crash-landed her spacecraft, the second installment of this anime series continues the wacky adventures of Valkyrie and her human companion, teenager Kazuto Tokino. Highlights of this outlandish comedy include a giant drunken dog, a manga-addicted cyborg, a time warp adventure down memory lane, an enchanted sword that's fallen into the wrong hands and, of course, plenty of lathered skin.

link.synopsis: Although the film is a parody, the action is real in this gangster comedy from Hong Kong directors Gordon Chan and Dante Lam. When small-time goon Fat (Ronald Cheng) loses his memory, he convinces himself he's an undercover cop. In turn, two sexy cops convince him that he must now go after his old boss, Big Bro. But instead of ratting out the kingpin, Fat becomes his ally, as a rival gangster declares a turf war of his own against the big guy.

link.synopsis: A car thief (Rajnikanth) who was kidnapped as a boy to serve as ransom for a priceless sword reunites with his parents as an adult. But after being raised by a criminal, can he turn his life around and walk the straight and narrow? Anitha and Suhasini co-star in this Bollywood blend of comedy, romance and drama, with a little magic thrown in for good measure.
link.title: synopsis

link.synopsis: A respectable Indian family goes to ridiculous lengths to impress the glamorous movie star who's moved in next door, all because she plans to pay them a visit. But when she finally comes to call, her reaction isn't anything like what they expected. Muthuraman, Jayanthi, Nagesh and Showkar Janaki co-star in this farcical Bollywood comedy of modern manners.
link.title: synopsis

link.synopsis: Picking the pockets of a stranger gives a clever thief (Wallace Ford) easy access to a bank stuffed with cash, and now he's working on the inside as the bank's manager -- with plans to pull off the heist of a lifetime. Of course, one of his first acts as bank boss is to hire his criminal associates so they can work there as full-time employees and help him plot the robbery. Luana Walters co-stars in this classic comedy.

link.synopsis: A con man (Roscoe Karns) goes to great lengths to impress his visiting son by "borrowing" a mansion and posing as a successful boxing promoter in this classic comedy. Why the facade? After years of telling lies to his war-hero son (Joseph Allen), "Big Time" Percy Morgan isn't about to start telling the truth: that he's actually a big-time loser. Maxie Rosebloom and Luis Alberni co-star as Morgan's partners in crime.

link.synopsis: Forged during the golden era of vaudeville and silent-screen slapstick, comedy duo Stan Laurel and Oliver Hardy became one of the few teams to successfully transition to the more rigorous demands of talkies. This vintage collection contains some of the pair's early shorts, including their first screen appearance together in 1921's A Lucky Dog (a collaboration with pioneering producer Mack Sennett) and Yes, Yes, Nanette (1925), directed by Laurel.

link.synopsis: In this quirky British comedy, newlyweds Edward (Nick Moran) and Samantha (Keeley Hawes) arrive at their honeymoon hotel, only to find it flooded with undertakers attending their annual convention. The horrified Edward wants to leave immediately, but Samantha convinces him to stay until morning. During the night, however, a prominent mortician is murdered, and the couple quickly gets caught up in the mystery surrounding his bizarre death.

link.synopsis: In this airy comedy, budding filmmaker Ibo (Denis Moschitto) dreams of helming a German kung fu flick but first hones his talent with a commercial for his uncle's kebab stand. Ibo's ad -- a martial arts parody featuring dueling shish kebabs -- becomes a huge hit. But things go downhill when his girlfriend turns up pregnant, his family gives him the boot, he gets embroiled in a restaurant feud and … he attracts unwanted attention from the mob.

link.synopsis: In this screwball comedy, gay soap opera star Cliff (Chris Bruno) plans to marry socialite Cory (Linda Larkin) in order to shore up his reputation as a hunky leading man. Unhappy about Cliff's deep-in-the-closet status, his lover (Jack Koenig) nonetheless agrees to be the best man. But when Cory's maid of honor and her boyfriend arrive, the ever-widening circle of lies makes this trip down the aisle look more like an obstacle course!

link.synopsis: The politically incorrect wit of popular stand-up comedian Ralphie May is showcased in this concert based on his Comedy Central special. May gained fame with his unique blend of hip-hop style, topical humor and Southern flair. In Girth of a Nation, he spoofs a variety of topics in routines such as "Black Movie Theater," "Midgets," "Mentally Challenged Americans," "Rusty the Retard," "Popeapalooza," "Smokin' Weed with Jesus" and more.

link.synopsis: Director and provocateur David Lynch ("Twin Peaks," Mulholland Drive) doles out his trademark style -- albeit in smaller doses -- with this collection of seven short films that were once available only to members of his personal Web site. Touching on drama, comedy, narrative and horror, the collection also includes experiments with an intervalometer camera, plus a  session with Lynch answering questions from Web site members.

link.synopsis: After discovering that his mother isn't actually a widow -- and that his real father is serving a jail sentence for a crime he didn't commit -- Ajay Sharma (Ajay Devgan) recruits his roguish friend (Akshay Kumar) to help him round up the corrupt official (Suresh Oberoi) who's responsible. Karisma Kapoor and Aruna Irani co-star in this blend of action and comedy from director Sandesh Kohli.
link.title: synopsis

link.synopsis: It's a case of purposely mistaken identity in this outlandish Bollywood comedy that finds a humble academic pretending to be someone he's not. Botany professor Anant Patil (Ramesh) is hopelessly in love with the beautiful Sulekha (Neetha), so much so that he marries her despite strong objections from her status-conscious brother (Dattatreya). Now, his only hope is to disguise himself as a Kannada-speaking driver. But can he really pull it off?
link.title: synopsis

link.synopsis: In this campy comedy teeming with drama queens and soap opera satire, grasping friends and deceitful relatives target rich diva Victoria Gaylord after learning that she has an incurable illness. Unaware that her backstabbing loved ones plan to take over her estate and her fortune, Victoria invites them to share her remaining days. Joe Haggerty, Holly Karrol Clark, Caleb Campbell, Buck Davis and Damien Christopher also star.

link.synopsis: Love and confusion are the themes in this hilarious Dean Martin double feature combining two raucous romantic comedy romps. In How to Save a Marriage, Dino plays the well-intentioned David, who vows to fix his philandering buddy's (Eli Wallach) marriage -- with riotous results! In Who Was That Lady? real-life couple, Tony Curtis and Janet Leigh team with Martin in a wacky tumble of mixed messages, romance and political espionage.
